topic.title: Channel Rate Limiter

body.p: The channel rate limiter provides precise per channel rate control for each test packet generator channel. The channel rate limiter contributes to the channel XOFF that is passed to the channel scheduler.

Each channel has a credit counter that accumulates byte credits at a programmable rate. The channel rate limiter prevents the packet assembler from sending data for a channel until it has accumulated enough credits to send the next unit of data. The channel rate limiter decreases the credit counter by the number of bytes sent, and repeats until the number of credits again becomes insufficient for the next unit of data to be sent on that channel. Each channel has a configurable maximum credit accumulation threshold, and status indications for credit accumulator overflow events.
